messages: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:11): seems Native Client is out of the box
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:12): or should I say, ActiveG
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:19): a stable Chrome came out

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:19): http://chrome.blogspot.com/2011/09/new-stable-release-of-chrome-expanding.html?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+blogspot%2FEgta+%28Google+Chrome+Blog%29
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:19): euh
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:19): http://chrome.blogspot.com/2011/09/new-stable-release-of-chrome-expanding.html
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:19): what is it with all this URL cruft these days
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (18:19): did people stop caring?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (18:21): Yay, now I can experience web applications that fail because they don't support my CPU
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (18:21): Yet another reason to use Chrome
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:21): As I non-chrome-user I can not experience web applications that fail because they don't support my CPU
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:22): Is it possible to die of Google-demo starvation?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (18:22): If not I think I'll be OK
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (18:23): wonders whether NaCl applications can rely on SSE/SSE2/etc instructions

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (18:24): (If not then that sounds bad for performance which is basically the only point of NaCl; if so then it sounds bad for portability which is a significant point of the web)

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (18:25): would like to rely on SSE2 for offline applications but collected some stats like http://zaynar.co.uk/0ad-pub/cpucaps.html and found that 1% of the application's users still don't support it 10 years after it was introduced :-(
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:35): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: (No JS JIT in any shipped browser works on x86 without SSE2)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:36): (But you probably knew that already)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (18:37): (SpiderMonkey's does)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (18:38): (at least as of some months ago)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:39): Does it use x87 or just do all fp through C++?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (18:39): (and anyway you can run JS without a JIT, whereas you can't run NaCl without hardware support for whatever instructions the application uses)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (18:39): It uses x87
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:40): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: But their regexp JIT won't, because the JSC stuff definitely doesn't support x87.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (18:41): knows since he encountered x87 JIT bugs in it a while ago
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:41): (Not that I can think of any reason for regexp to use floats at all)
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (18:42): Well, we don't care about JITting regexps, so that's fine
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (18:42): Surely it'd be a better use of engineering effort to just hard-code the regexps that benchmarks use

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:43): (We have x87 support, though never shipped as it's a bit too buggy and fixing those bugs has never really been a priority. We also have support for JIT with no FPU.)
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (18:44): Opera is weird like that :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:45): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81: What? Not bug-fixing it? Or the no-FPU support?
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (18:45): Supporting obscure platforms
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:46): Eh, still plenty of TVs and the like which have no FPU.
57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450 (18:46): many ARM procs don't have an FPU
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:47): 57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450: ARM not so much nowadays, MIPS on the other hand‚Ä¶
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:56): 57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450: Also, e.g., the HTC Wilffire doesn't have VFP.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (18:57): 57d876083caf517f49e8cf5e03307450: So there are some fairly popular devices without a FPU.
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (19:00): keep those crappy devices from having a usable browser, so they become less popular :P
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (19:03): 06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6: The default WebKit-based browser has JIT, I'm fairly certain.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (19:03): (wait, it's V8, it must have JIT)
